sections.heading: Before a Landslide
items: Learn if your area is prone to landslides and sign up for alerts.
Look for warning signs: cracks in soil, tilting trees, stuck doors/windows.
Consult professionals for proper drainage and slope stabilization.
Avoid building on steep slopes or near drainage paths.
Prepare an evacuation plan and go-bag.

sections.heading: During a Landslide
items: Evacuate immediately if you observe rapid water flow or earth movement.
Listen for unusual sounds: cracking trees or rumbling.
If indoors, move to the upper floor or the opposite side of the slope.
If outdoors, move away from the path of the flow to higher ground.
Be alert for flooding; landslides can block rivers and cause flash floods.

sections.heading: After a Landslide
items: Stay away from the slide area; secondary slides may occur.
Check for injured and trapped persons; call for help.
Report broken utility lines to authorities.
Inspect foundations and structures for damage before re-entering.
Document damage and follow local guidance for debris removal.
